main event: According to the radar operator, a single round, silver-colored object was observed on the radar screen for a period of approximately 2-3 minutes. The object was moving at a high rate of speed and remained at the same altitude during the observation.
interesting points: The report contains detailed time entries, locations, and degrees of moving objects above the horizon in Moraine, Ohio from July 9 to July 16, 1962.
The object was detected on radar and appeared to be moving at a high rate of speed while maintaining a constant altitude.
The witness estimated the speed of the object to be between 350-400 mph and the distance to be approximately 1/2 mile.
The witness indicated that this was not the first time they had seen similar objects, suggesting prior sightings.
Multiple observers were present, and the report indicates that some of them also saw the object.
sighted object: single round, silver-colored object detected on radar
